alert.note: Alert for Camden; Eastern Currituck; Western Currituck (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 2:46PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Camden, and Currituck Counties and the southeastern City of Virginia Beach through 330 PM EDT... At 245 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Currituck to Indiantown to near Old Trap. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 to 45 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Grandy around 250 PM EDT. Knotts Island around 255 PM EDT. Sanderling around 300 PM EDT. Corolla around 305 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Poplar Branch, Snowden, Spot, Aydlett, Gregory, Munden, Jarvisburg, Barco, Coinjock and Powells Point. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
